q: Obedience and respect for authority are the most important virtues children should learn.
What this country needs most, more than laws and political programs, is a few courageous, tireless, devoted leaders in whom the people can put their faith.
Workers in the most essential parts of the economy should not be allowed to strike.
Prisoners should be forced to work to repay their debt to society.
At some point, the state will no longer be necessary.
Ideally, politicians would not exist.
Private ownership of land is natural and desirable.
Private investors play an essential role in the economy.
Landlords have an important role to play by providing housing for people who can’t afford to buy.
Theft can never be justified.
Inheritance is not a legitimate form of wealth.
The destruction of property is not violence, or comparable to assault.
Victimless crimes, or crimes where the victim is society, should not be considered crimes at all.
Society does not exist, there are only individuals.
If people wish to sell their organs they should be permitted to.
Trade between two consenting individuals should never be obstructed.
Some things are too important to be left to market forces.
Economic competition corrodes the fabric of society.
Individuals should have full control of their work.
Monopolies, state or otherwise, can never be allowed to exist.
Hierarchy cannot exist without coercion.
Capitalism and the state are evils which perpetuate one another.
Large organisations cannot exist without some form of top down structure.
Worker co-ops are not any better than traditional firms.
People’s basic needs should be provided for free.
Humans have the potential to be fully altruistic, but our current system makes people selfish.
A communist society is a desirable end goal.
More laws should be determined by referendums.
Tyranny of the majority is a legitimate concern.
Equality of outcome is a dangerous goal to pursue.
The most important parts of the economy should be nationalised.
The economy needs regulating by the government in order to function correctly.
Income tax is a necessary evil, if an evil at all.
Education should be state run to ensure quality education for all children.
State welfare programs should be replaced by charity or mutual aid.
The state should play a smaller role in the economy.
